comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: No Opera House. Pre 1973! I wonder whether the tower under construction mid way between the Town Hall tower and St James' spire might be the Australia Hotel (Castlereagh St)...maybe some time in early 1890...but if this were so, I'm then surprised we can't see any action at either the Lands Office tower or the GPO tower (both completed in 1891). Another puzzle involves what looks like the Pastoral Finance Association wool store around at Kirribilli (seen here www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05/9027723985/in/photolis... ) ...I gather it was under construction in 1890...evidently completed in 1891... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article111988141 ...in this pic above the exterior looks to be fairly complete...though it's a bit hard to tell...a few more grains of resolution might help...why didn't these photographers use T-Max?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I think you are right about the Australia Hotel being built, but the tower is the GPO not the Town Hall. Maybe?! And the PFA is the Miles Building in Gloucester St - link in note. Also www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05/7799953792/ Puzzled by the titling - I bet it originally said " 78. SYDNEY FROM "CREMORNE" (H. KING, PHOTO SYD.) " - ie this is another Henry King copy, and explains the early dating.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] think I've been looking at too many photos...ie. the GPO tower was completed in 1885...scaffolding removed in early 1886... www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05/8721378499/in/photolis... ; I think you're correct re the GPO tower...from Cremorne Point, the Town Hall should appear a little further to the left...but I wonder where it is...maybe partly obscured by a tree branch? ...surely not out of frame to the left though?... I'd also agree that's not the PFA wool store... if I've got the Mort & Co wool store correct, then the date range is 1887 (Mort & Co wool store extension) - 1891 (Lands Office Tower)...
